str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I end, finish, (b) I fulfill, accomplish, (c) I pay. From telos; to end, i.e. Complete, execute, conclude, discharge.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To change my place (abode), leave, depart, remove, pass over. From meta and the base of basis; to change place.
Thence, from that place. From ekei; thence.
To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
